original: Mossberg, Karl-Åke Fredrik, lektor, Visby, f. 10/3/07 i Bengtsfors, Älvsib. 1., av Emil M. o. Julia Heintz. G. 36 m. Elkn Norblad. Barn: Agneta f. 38, Karl Lennart 42, Kerstin 44. — Stud:ex. i Karlstad 25, fil. kand. i Upps. 29, fil. mag. s. å., fil. liic. 32, ef-terprövn. 33, disp.. f. gr. 34, provår v. norra latin i St him 35. Vik. lektor i Karlstad 30, e. o. ämneslär. v. Lunds-bergs sk. 31, åter i Karlistad 33, vik. adj. där 34, e. o. ämneslär. v. Sigtuna human, lärov. 36, extralär. v. norra latin 36-37, e. o. adj. där 38-39, adj. i latin o. grek. i Karlstad 39, lektor i s. ä. vid Visby h. a. 1. sed. 42. Bibi. där sed. 46. Handled, v. norra latin 36-39, kursförf. f. Noréns korresp :inst. Ordf. i Gotl. human, förb., Värml.-Dals gille i Visby, Gotl. Konsum, styr :led. i ,fp. o. Kyrkobröd. Visby-avd. Resa t. Ital. 38. Skr.: Studia Sidoniana (grad:avh.), Korresp :kurs i latin.
translated: Mossberg, Karl-Åke Fredrik, teacher, Visby, b. 10/3/07 in Bengtsfors, Älvsborg County, son of Emil M. and Julia Heintz. Married in 1936 to Elkn Norblad. Children: Agneta b. 1938, Karl Lennart b. 1942, Kerstin b. 1944. — Secondary school diploma in Karlstad in 1925, Bachelor of Arts in Uppsala in 1929, Master of Arts in the same year, licentiate degree in 1932, further studies in 1933, doctoral degree in 1934, probationary year at the northern Latin school in Stockholm in 1935. Temporary teacher in Karlstad in 1930, acting subject teacher at Lundsberg school in 1931, back in Karlstad in 1933, acting adjutant there in 1934, acting subject teacher at Sigtuna humanistic high school in 1936, part-time teacher at the northern Latin school in 1936-1937, acting adjutant there in 1938-1939, Latin and Greek teacher in Karlstad in 1939, lecturer in the same subject at Visby high school since 1942. Bibi. there since 1946. Handled, at the northern Latin school from 1936 to 1939, course instructor for Norén's correspondence institute. Chairman of the Gotland Humanistic Association, Värmland-Dalarna Guild in Visby, Gotland Cooperative, board member of the Liberal People's Party and Church Bread. Traveled to Italy in 1938. Writings: Studia Sidoniana (thesis), Correspondence course in Latin.
